newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Islamic list wins West bank student election.
newsitem.headline: Islamic list wins West bank student election.

text.p: Supporters of the Islamic Hamas group on Monday won most seats in a West Bank student council election seen as a test of strength between the PLO and rival groups, university officials said.
They said Hamas supporters, running as the Islamic list, won 19 of 35 seats for the student assembly. The group kept its control of the student body.
Israel handed most of the town of Hebron to Palestinian self-rule in January. The town is a traditional stronghold of militant Moslem groups.
Supporters of Palestinian President Yasser Arafat's Fatah movement won 15 seats and backers of the radical Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) won one seat.
University officials said 1,343 out of a student body of 1,400 voted. The Hamas list received 701 votes compared to 538 votes for the list affiliated to Fatah.
Palestinians held their first national elections in January 1996 but Hamas, with most other opposition groups, officially boycotted the poll.

Students affiliated to Hamas control student councils in most universities in the West Bank and Gaza Strip. Hamas opposes Israeli-PLO peace moves, now frozen due to Israel's settlement policy in the West Bank.
